result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexandra K Scola was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alexandra K Scola is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Alexandra K Scola was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concur to 15CF420, 14CF2244, 15CF911, 15CF1801 and 15CM186.
10/6/15 Crt orders 51 days credit (prev 0)

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$250 DNA surcharge + court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.

Def not to be at Walgreens or A Room of One's Own. Def not to be at any pawn shop, resale store or any business who buys merchandise from public.  Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with NM, SL, AS, AM or JS.

Maintain permanent residence. Upon release from jail, def to have curfew from 1 hr before work/treatment until 1 hr after until agent modifies or deletes condition. Def to file tax returns on time and provide copy to agent and all refunds to be applied to rest owed.  Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

supervisions.notes: Concur to 14CF2244.  Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

  Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights signed; Ct accepted plea; BMP referral form completed

CASH BOND SET - REFERRAL TO BMP
- Cash bail is set at $1,000 per case. This case bail shall revert to a signature bond in the amount of $1,000 per case - upon Defendant's acceptance into Rogers Memorial Hospital for treatment. Defendant must immediately report to DCBM upon release.

- Defendant must sign a Medical Release for Treatment at Rogers Memorial - to be provided by Dane County Bail Monitoring.
